titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Montauk Fire Insurance Company insurance policy to Christopher Jacobson 1977.512
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-12-01 19:32:16 +0000.

did.unittitle: Montauk Fire Insurance Company insurance policy to Christopher Jacobson

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Montauk Fire Insurance Company (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: An 1887 insurance policy issued by the Montauk Fire Insurance Company of Brooklyn to Christopher Jacobson for a home in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Gravesend.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Montauk Fire Insurance Company insurance policy to Christopher Jacobson, 1887, 1977.512, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Insurance policy issued by the Montauk Fire Insurance Company of Brooklyn to Christopher Jacobson for a home in the Brooklyn neighborhood of Gravesend. It is dated October 4, 1887.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
